column6: "reviewText": "Installing the game was a struggle (because of games for windows live bugs).Some championship races and cars can only be \"unlocked\" by buying them as an addon to the game. I paid nearly 30 dollars when the game was new. I don't like the idea that I have to keep paying to keep playing.I noticed no improvement in the physics or graphics compared to Dirt 2.I tossed it in the garbage and vowed never to buy another codemasters game. I'm really tired of arcade style rally/racing games anyway.I'll continue to get my fix from Richard Burns Rally
column7: and you should to. :)http://www.amazon.com/Richard-Burns-Rally-PC/dp/B000C97156/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1341886844&sr;=8-1&keywords;=richard+burns+rallyThank you for reading my review! If you enjoyed it
column8: be sure to rate it as helpful."
column10: "summary": "Pay to unlock content? I don't think so."

column6: "reviewText": "If you like rally cars get this game you will have fun.It is more oriented to "European market" since here in America there isn't a huge rally fan party. Music it is very European and even the voices from the game very "English" accent.The multiplayer isn't the best but it works just ok."

"reviewText": "1st shipment received a book instead of the game.2nd shipment got a FAKE one. Game arrived with a wrong key inside on sealed box. I got in contact with codemasters and send them pictures of the DVD and the content. They said nothing they can do its a fake DVD.Returned it good bye.!"
"reviewText": "I got this version instead of the PS3 version
column7: which turned out to be a mistake. Console versions of games look 95 percent as good as their PC versions
column8: but you do not have to deal with driver issues and the numerous things that can go wrong with windows. First off the installation takes about 30 minutes
column9: which is ridiculous. I have never had a game take this long to load
column10: Shift 2 took about 20 minutes which seemed too long also. Next many of the latest games for PC are forcing you to have an internet connection in order to install the game
column11: regardless of whether you want to play only offline single player games. Shift 2 unleashed is also like this
column12: so be forewarned. Internet requirements are not prominently displayed on the boxes. The game pushes you
column13: but does not require you to
column14: sign up for a Games For Windows Live account
column15: which is required to get the game patches and updates. More time wasted signing up for that. Finally after about one hour the game was up and running
column16: but the menu screen text had red blocky borders
column17: and the sun in the game screens was ugly pink red
column18: with red reflections on the car and everywhere. So more time spent googling to find a solution to this. I had to download a hot-fix driver update for my AMD videocard driver
column19: which solved that red text and sun problem. Finally after nearly 2 hours I was able to play the game
column20: which is perhaps the prettiest racing game I have ever played. Magnificent graphics
column21: and fun excellent gameplay. Good forcefeedback effects with a steering wheel
column22: and excellent sense of speed and immersion
column23: makes this a top notch sim racer with just a hint of arcade feeling to it.I was really
column25: when suddenly about 30 minutes in to a race the game suddenly crashed. No error message or anything
column26: it just hung up and crashed to desktop
column27: under windows 7. I later tried it with Windows XP on the same machine
column29: usually only when exiting the game
column30: but random crashes really kill the fun of a racing game
column31: since it might not crash during an entire 20 lap race or it might crash on the 2nd lap.It is a great game when it works
column32: and if you are lucky enough to have a machine that it runs stably on then by all means get this game. But hang on to your receipt just in case.I am tired of fiddling with my computer trying to find a totally reliable setup for this game
column33: so I think I am going to buy a copy for my PS3
column35: in over 3 years of game playing. I have been buying the top notch PC versions of videogames and spent thousands of dollars over the years on faster videocards and cpu's
column36: but I have finally grown tired of fiddling with incompatibilities of hardware and software
column37: and now game publishers demanding that you have an internet connection as well as providing a long serial number
column39: 30 minute or longer installation times ( it takes less time to install Windows 7 )
column40: and requiring you to sign up for their online service and game store
column41: and still you have to put that stupid little DVD in your computer everytime you want to play a simple game to relax. I am pretty much done with PC gaming
column42: since the consoles are so much less hassle
column43: and they have \" good enough \" graphics that the diminishing returns of costly higher resolution better antialiased higher framerate graphics is not worth it. When the PS4 and Xbox 720 come out
column44: I think the law of diminishing returns will be even more evident."
column47: if it did not crash frequently !!"

column6: "reviewText": "I had Dirt 2 on Xbox 360 and it was an okay game. I started playing games on my laptop and bought a few new games to build my collection. This game is very fun to play. It is so much better than Dirt 2. If you like racing games you should check this out. The graphics are perfect on my compter."
"reviewText": "Overall this is a well done racing game
column7: with very good graphics for its time period. My family has has enjoyed playing it a great deal. I personally think a steering wheel controller is almost a necessity for this game
column8: but an x box type controller would probably work. The keyboard would be almost impossible
column9: and not very fun. The \"windows live\" system detracts greatly
column10: since you must log in and be online to play or save game progress. There was a mees up with my \"Live\" log in and the game would no longer accept my activation code and I had to rebuy the game if I wanted to play. There is no customer support at all. Dirt 2 suffers from this serious flaw as well. 4 1/2 star game 1 star Windows Live feature."

column6: "reviewText": "Loved playing Dirt 2 and I thought the graphics were good.  Purchased Dirt 3 as an addition to the other...and the graphics are absolutely \"Gorgeous\"  If you liked Dirt or Dirt 2...you are going to love Dirt 3.  The game was easier to configure with my Logitech wireless rumblepad...and with my EVGA GTX 580
column7: and all detail set to full on graphics at 1920 x 1080 I get over 100 fps.  The game looks good
column8: plays well and is a blast!"
column10: "summary": "A step up from Dirt 2 and that is terrific!"

column6: "reviewText": "I can't tell you what a piece of dog**** this game is. Like everything else Microsoft makes- it doesn't work. When are they going to take a cue from Apple and make things that actually work the first time and every time. To log onto this game they make you jump through a series of hoops that takes like 15 min. to accomplish. If you want another disappointment from Microsoft
column7: buy some \"Games for Windows Live\" games.  I just wanted a simple arcade like driving game when I have a young boy visiting. If that's what you want
column8: don't buy this. If you want to hire a consultant to help you run this game
column11: every time I do get this game to play my joystick stops working (there's Windows 7 for you)"

column6: "reviewText": "I initially gave this one star because it was crashing on me constantly but I recently narrowed it down to a plug-in I was using for my porsche wheel. Game plays well and looks gorgeous when image spanned across three monitors. I would have given it five stars if it wasn't for the annoying Microsoft Games for Live application that makes you go through hoops to set it up and causes problems of it's own (occasional crashes)"
column8: "summary": "A great game ruined by Microsoft's account management system"

column6: "reviewText": "I still haven't figured this one out. Did everything as instructed but the game never installed. Strange. Since I don't like to rate on something I couldn't get to work
column7: I'll just say that I didn't like it because I couldn't get it to work :P For those that did manage to get it installed
column8: I'm sure it's a great game. I had the first Dirt and it was a scream! Too bad this one bombed. Maybe a bad disc..."
